title: Actually Quite Good
text: We stopped for a short notice meal and were pleasantly surprised. The service was good, price was very reasonable and the food was quite good. Choice of 4 joints, all the veg and two types of roasties. Veg could have been a bit hotter and an extra server on the carvery would have made it a bit quicker

title: Fascinating Slice through History
text: Probably the focus of most tourist visits to Athens, this did not disappoint. there is a lot of work going on to restore and protect the whole site but given that parts of it are 3000 years old . Be warned its not disabled friendly and is a bit of a hike uphill on pretty uneven surfaces

title: Excellent Food
text: This place is probably worth a visit on its own. Great food and terrific view of the Acropolis. It would have rated 5 starts but the service was indifferent.

title: Well Worth a Visit
text: This is a really interesting place for the history buffs and the top floor exhibition of original stones laid out correctly to scale is fascinating. There is also an excellent roof top cafe/restaurant with great views

title: Really Excellent Restaurant
text: Close the Acropolis Museum and Metro its worth hunting thus place out. The 3 of us chose a range of mains fro. An interesting menu which included vegetarian and fish options. We all agreed our choices were excellent; the best meal we had in Athens and all the others were good too. Take a trip away from the main tourist area around the Agora and try this place - you won't be disappointed.

title: Great Location
text: The hotel is very well located only a 5-10 min walk of the Acropolis and only slightly longer to the main sites. If you are lucky you may get a room with an oblique view of it from the link balcony. Room was well appointed with a nice bathroom and the 3rd bed we requested was a proper one not a sofa bed. Pool area looked nice but water was freezing. We ate in the top floor restaurant on our first night and had a excellent meal. The area was mainly residential but there was plenty of bars and restaurants in the area.

title: Excellent Sunday Lunch
text: Just enjoyed a really good Sunday lunch in a very Covid aware environment that still managed to retain its atmosphere. Set menu priced at £22/26 for 2/3 courses and the food was excellent. Unhurried, friendly and attentive staff managed to be both efficient and unobtrusive at the same time. Definitely on the list to return.

title: It's a long walk
text: The train was not operating and, though a pleasant walk, was more of an ordeal in wind and rain. Most things were open but the cafe at the end had a very limited range of just cakes and drinks. Would do it again but only in nice weather.

title: Loved it.
text: Booked ahead and got a table inside, on a warm evening an outside table would have been lovely as its a great setting. Service was excellent from all the staff we encountered and the food was very good and the CoVid limited menu was more than enough choice.

title: Really excellent fish and chips
text:
Tried for an inside table but restaurant was running shorter hours as part of its CoVid recovery and it was too cold to sit outside,
so settled for takeaway fish and chips. Hardly really "settled for" as, apart from the eating in the car, it was the best fish and chips ever. Would love to go back for the full restaurant experience.

title: Nice little off beat tapas restaurant
text: Enjoyed a very pleasant meal post theatre. Lovely setting and friendly staff. Food is excellent and the portoon sizes are fine. Could get expensive if you loaded up the tapas, but worth a special visit.

title: Nice Hotel on the Edge of Town
text:
Hotel is located about 15 mins walk from the lifts by the ski school meeting place and a little closer to the gondola. A shuttle is available and they have an "arrangement" with Rent and Go for ski/books storage which is well worthwhile pretty much wherever you are staying.
The hotel has a bit of character and charm but was very quiet when we stayed. A very good breakfast buffet with a cooked option available on demand. Not sure whether they do evening meals but there are plenty of places in town. There is plenty of free parking outside the hotel. The rooms are comfortable and very warm if probably a little dated and our room had a tiny shower cubicle. Everything was spotlessly clean.
Getting here is a relatively easy 75min drive from Turin, mostly on motorway with only the last 10 miles on mountain roads which were kept clear throughout our stay. Get winter tyres and/or chains for peace of mind though.

title: Excellent New Year's Eve Meal
text: Booked late and was pleased to find no excessive New Year's Eve surcharge or pricing, normal menu with specials and a £10 deposit to book a table. Place was lively with a mix of eating a drinks only customers. Serving staff were great. Shout out to Josie who managed to look calm and smiley all evening whilst seeming to be in perpetual motion. Food was very good, I had the rump off the specials menu which was good to a perfect "medium well" and the others had burgers of differing sizes which were equally good. have been before and would definitely go back.

title: Very Good Food
text: Restaurant is the top floor of a very ancient timbered building, with seating for about 50. We chose for the al la carte menu where starters are £7-14, mains £16-32 and a variety of sides in the £3-5 range. There are 2 or 3 course set menu options available for lunchtimes and weekdays. I had a very tasty french onion soup for starter (could have been a main) and a main if liver and bacon which was cooked to perfection. Others in the party had the daal or duck for their mains bother very good, but they did look on enviously as tempura plaice arrived at the adjacent table - menu envy. Drinks are about the price you would expect from the standard of restaurant but they did serve glass by the wine which is good if not all of your party are drinking. Overall an excellent meal served in a very pleasant setting with good unobtrusive service. Its quite pricey if you have 3 courses on a Saturday night with some sides and drinks, but a great location for a special occasion meal.

title: 3rd Visit and we would come back
text:
This was our 3rd visit to Grand Palladium though before although we booked Kentenah we were allocated Colonial. No real difference, but I did feel the room was slightly more "tired" than previous years. We have returned twice because of all the good things other reviewers have mentioned: food - quality and variety; facilities - extensive; beach - lovely (but you need to pick your entry point to avoid some rocks); staff - friendly and efficient; animation team - full of fun and energy; evening entertainers - really, really good. There was no issue with seaweed which has previously been reported on this coastline. We would certainly return and have happily recommended the place to friends and family.

The resort is huge but there are loads of trips bookable either through the hotel or your travel company. We can recommend Excaret and Xplor, both brilliant days out, we did the ATV/Cenote and Zip-lining trip which was a blast, and caught "Collectivos" for 40 pesos to Playa del Carmen and to the ruins at Tulum which is worth a visit, you can hire a guide when you get there.

Overall we have enjoyed 3 excellent holidays at this hotel and are already thinking about a 4th. My daughter is even going to try and get a gap year job there as she speaks Spanish.

title: Great location and good food
text: Enjoyed a Sunday Lunch at this lovely riverside spot. The set 2 or 3 course menu was very good value and the al a carte though more expensive didn't seem unreasonable. personally, I enjoyed the roast lamb and Sunday lunch trimmings which was prepared very well. Tried my daughter's ham hock terrine starter, full of flavour if a little salty. Sweets were tasty too. For a party of 8 with drinks our bill was "50 including a service charge. There is a tiny car park but plenty of street parking nearby though it was a Sunday I imagine it was be a little more hectic during the week. The restaurant also has an outdoor refreshment kiosk and you can hire punts as well to get the full Oxford experience.

title: Very good steak place
text: If you like an occasional steak, then go somewhere where its their speciality, and this place is just that. This is a very old pub by a small river. Looks good inside and has some outside seating (way too cold when we went). Its not particularly expensive with £25.95 fixed price 3 course Sunday menu. The portions are reasonably generous and our party of 4 shared 2 meals. Steaks were excellent and even well done retained their flavour and were tender and juicy. Both starters - mushrooms and scallops- were highly rated and tge puddings were good too. Add in the very friendly servuce from Jill and you have the recipe for a great meal out.

title: Lovely Spot but very Crowded
text: The church was very busy and outside the narrow streets were crowded. It was lovely though with some space to enjoy a picnic overlooking the city.

title: Well worth buying a skip the line package to save queuing.
text: The high point - literally - of our trip. We paid extra to skip the lines which was worth it. Once in/on/up the Tower, and apart from the lifts, it was not crowded and there was time and space to enjoy the views and grab a bagette in the cafe.

title: Good Value and reasonably close to .the Eiffel Toer
text:
Enjoyed 4 nights here over Easter as part of a Eurostar Package weekend. Hotel is about 1km from the base of the Tower and if your room is high enough and facing the right way you may even get a view. Its also close to a couple of Metro lines about 7 mins walk. First room allocated had not been serviced even though we were checking in at 5pm. We were then upgraded to a better room, so thanks. The place was very busy but the room was quiet and comfortable. Only complaint was they did not advertise the single bottle of Evian left in an otherwise empty fridge wasn't complimentary so a bit surprised by a €20 charge after we had checked out otherwise it would be 5 stars.

Its a €25 taxi ride from Gare du Nord which in retrospect would have been worthwhile having been pickpocked and had £80 stolen and the faff of cancelling cards, obviously nothing the hotel could do about that.

title: Excellent Brunch
text: Just enjoyed a realy good Sunday brunch. Interesting menu, we settled on bubble & squeak, eggs benedict and Okka special. All very good, freshly made and served with a smile. Well worth a visit.

title: Great place to eat traditional food
text: We enjoyed a very snowy Saturday night meal at this place. It was very quiet but the snow was raging outside so maybe expected but is was well worth the trek to the far end of the village. Really good schnitzel, and an excellent kass spetzle, very friendly service and not expensive.

title: Lovely Restaurants - Leo's - we kept going back
text: Very good traditional menu with daily specials as well. Portions were generous, the schnitzel was excellent and the Kaiserschmarm was definitely for sharing. Heartily recommended and worth a trip from the village centre.

title: Not that great really
text: Main complaint was the service was indfferent and it allows smoking indoors which means everything smells a bit. The house pizza was quite good and the prices generally seemed reasonable.

title: Lovely mountain side dining
text: Full of atmoshere, very friendly and a lovely spot for lunch. Try the gulashsuppe its a beef stew in all but name and great value. Its busy at lunchtime so you will need to be prepared to share especially if the weather means the outside tables cant be used.

title: Realy nice but pricy.
text: Lovely food, well prepared and served in a very smart setting. Extensive choice of foods and wines. Main course and soft drinks for 2 was €55.

title: Lovely place but mostly reds so may not suit beginners or nervous skiers
text: Just returned. It snowed pretty much non stop which reduced our skiing days from 4 to 3 and made some of the many reds more difficult as they could not keep up with pisting them

title: Excellent hotel only 100 metres from lifts
text: We shared a double room which was equipped with full facilities for a self catering holiday, though we just boiled water for drinks and ate out. It was spotlessly clean and run by a very friendly family team in traditional Austrian dress. Breakfast was typical Austrian fare, rolls, meats, cheeses, fruits and cereals and plenty to set you up for the day. There is parking adjacent to the Hotel but its worth getting a space in the underground car park if you can to reduce the amount of digging out when it snows heavily. Kuhtai is about 40 mins from Innsbruck Airport but if the weather is bad chains are needed. Hotel Kristal at the far end of Kuhtai with a walk of 15 mins to the main centre. There is an excellent restaurant across the road for a traditional Tyrolean meal. There is a small bar downstairs with limited opening and a small range of drinks and coffee. We would definitely return if holidaying in Kuhtai again

title: Really good village fish and chip shop
text: Since reopening as the Old Cottage the quality and service of fish and chips here has been first rate. Fish is cooked fresh to order so expect to wait a few minutes. There is usually a paperr to read and often small plates of free trips to eat while you are waiting. Portions are generous, we normally manage ine fish anf med chips between 2. They also offer some free accompanying sauces. We are very regular users.

title: Expensive, but Robbie Williams act was good
text: We were a party of 12 mixed adults and teenagers. The food was reasonable quality but I thought it over priced. Entertainment on the nite was very good but the background music was way to loud making it dificult to chat. Location was good but parking can be a problem

title: Good value
text: This was a good value stay. Quality is similar to a Premier Inn, staff were very friendly though drinks service was slow. Location central but not a "looker". Beds comfy but surprised that they did not use mattress protectors.

title: Engaging Tour Guide, but not much substance for £22
text: I was given a tour as a gift. It was a little disappointing though our guide was engaging and tried to inject something into it. They should try an make it more interactive and put more on display on the tour route, otherwise its just tramping around some rooms and a loom at the pitch.

title: Very impressed so coming back again this year
text: Stayed for 2 weeks on a TUI All Inc trip across the UK October half term. This place is terrific. Very big with excellent staff, loads of top quality restaurants, good buffets if you are impatient, several pools and a fantastic beach. Used the gym daily and daughter had a spa treatment as a birthday present, she loved it but I thought it was on the pricey side. The whole place is well run, looks good, is well maintained and just very, very good. Its an hour from Cancun and about 20mins by the the local mini-bus to Playa del Carmen and tge Tulem ruins. Would we go, we are this year but self-booking via Netflights rather than TUI as they had no availability. This is by far the best All Inc we have ever stayed in even better than Azul 5's (see earlier reviews).

title: Great views and a good restaurant to enjoy them from
text: Booked for 7pm for dinner and ate a very good meal watching the sun set on a very beatiful clear sky May evening. Worth the visit. Tickets and tables can be booked in advance from tne UK which saves queuing to get in and you can guaranteed a window seat.

title: Good value skiing hotel with great staff
text:
Just returned fron a 5 night stay booked via Neilson. This hotel is well located about 300 meters from the slopes. The hotel had a ski room but we rented lockers at Rent and Go.
Rooms are a reasonable size with an ensuite with a whirlpool bath and shower over, warm and clean. Food was fine, though the evening meals could have been served a bit hotter. Also suggest you move the plate warmer adjacent to the hot food buffet not the salad bar. There was an excellent selection of wines and the bar prices didn't seem excessive. The hotel had a small spa with steam room, sauna and jacuzzi as well as a couple of basic fitness machines. The guests were a mix of English and Italian in varying size and age family groups. All the front of house staff were very friendly and helpful.

I would certainly return to both the resort and hotel as both were very good and very good value.

title: Great pizzas, slow service
text: Went for a lunch and dinner here. The pizzas were brilliant but the service was a bit (very) slow as the place was very busy all the time. Prices seemed reasonable.

title: Great couple of hours
text: Under Simon's i managed 2 hours flying into Newquay, Heathrow and Innsbruck all without crashing. Great fun. Now just waiting the call overvthe intercom: "both pilots have had some dodgy shellfish, anyone out there land one of these babies"? Hell yeah! Really good fun and great birthday present.

title: Great little bar/cafe
text: Great little bar/cafe, ideal place to watch the aircraft after you've been on the simulator across the road.

title: Not quite sure what the hype is all about
text: Busy restaurant, very friendly staff, tasty but way too big burger, ridiculous amount of fries, and disappointingly greasy with the cheese add on. Not sure its twice as good as Burger King but it is more than twice the price. Would I go back? Probably but not especially. Great milkshake.

title: Good budget alternative
text: Just returned from a 4 day trip. Hotel was operated on a budget but rooms though (very) compact were clean and warm. Food was good though portions probably a little on the small side. Chalet staff were great. All very young but they worked hard for their customers. To much time was allowed for the 2hr transfer as the roads were snow and traffic free. This place never pretended to be a 5 star option, the price should make that quite clear, but if you are on a tight budget this compromise option may mean you could ski every year. One complaint, the bar prices were very high. Oh and I agree with previous reviews that the way in from the road would be treacherous in snow or ice.

title: OK, but not as good as previous visits
text: Visited for Sunday lunch and chose the carvery as before. The staff we all very helpful and attentive but the food was not as good as several previous visits, cold plates, luke warm food, and veg that was either overdone (carrots, yorkshires) or underdone (sprouts). The orangery was full booked and we ate in the restaurant which was fine, just not as well equipped for a carvery. We will eat there again because all our previous visits have beeb so good.

title: Excellent afternoon tea, in a lovely old coaching inn
text: We enjoyed a celebration afternoon tea for about 20 people in one of the numerous small rooms that the hotel has to offer. Food was very good and the service exceptionally good, could not have been more attentive.

title: Big room, great views and great service
text:
This hotel is located mi-way between the old and new areas of Havana. Both are walkable but the Hop-On buss at 10 CUC each for the day is a good way of getting around. Taxis are around 6-8 CUC.

We had a great view from the top-floor penthouse terrace out to sea and down the Malecon which is not as lively as the tourist info would suggest. Breakfast was fine though you have to aware that the menu is limited by what they have available. All the staff we met were very good and the concierge service for such a small hotel was excellent; they managed to get us a pink convertible american car at a couple of hours notice for my daughter's birthday treat.

This is a good, simple hotel that is handy for the sites of Havana but this is Cuba so you need to manage expectations around WiFi, food etc

title: Interesting and well located
text: The lift was out so I was given an upgraded junior suite on the 1st floor at the back. Lovely well-equipped room with a proper seating out area and a good bathroom. Very large and extremely comfortable bed. Sleep though was spoilt by the apparent cavalcade of bin lorries servicing the local business from 6am; why can't they all use the same firm? Excellent service from all the staff I encountered

title: Great size rooms and a good location
text: Stayed one night as part of a mission to survey serviced apartments for my company's travel programme. Room very clean and well equipped. Had a lower ground floor room; no view but seriously quiet so a very comfortable and undisturbed night's sleep. On the edge of China Town so lots of good eating

title: Excellent Thai Food
text: Been a few times and never disappointed. Usually have a mixed buffet but colleagues enjoyed single dish meals

title: EXcellent Sunday Roast
text: Enjoyed an excellent Sunday lunch here. Party all chose different roasts but they were all very good. Service, even though it was very busy, was first class (big shout out to Lily). Price seemed reasonable for the quality and location.

title: A Great Way to Watch Films
text: Recently restored to its Art Deco (I think) grandeur, this is the way to watch films. Very comfy seats with the option of sitting at a table, proper drinks and nibbles which are not too "cinema expensive". Overall a great experience. They play a mix of new films and classics and prices are reasonable for what you get.

title: More than an Afternoon
text: Really impressed with this place and particularly the US hangar. Well thought out, brilliant display of static aircraft with displays that told the human story behind the hardware. Only managed one other hangar so changed the tickets on the way to an annual pass to go back and do the rest one day.

title: very impressed
text: I stay in Manchester regularly but this was a first stay at the Arora. I must say I was very pleasantly surprised. Smart entrance, large well equipped bedroom, large bathroom with good toiletries. Usual buffet breakfast was good and staff were friendly and efficient

title: Not as good as it should be
text: the restaurant's special is an Italian "tapas" style menu of multiple small dishes with guests encouraged to share. good idea but in practice it meant after the first dish food was luke-warm to cold. Good menu and range though

title: Good place for a very relaxing break
text: I have been here twice for work related events. The place is very nice with great facilities set in some wonderful, if when I have been there very wet, surroundings. Rooms are clean and comfortable, food is good (but I only ate under the function menu). The lodges look interesting but I don't know how you book them. I would like to return on a family visit next time as I think the corporate event does not fully do it justice.

title: Great Food, Great Atmosphere
text: Really good meals served in a real country pub. Good range of beers I think, I am a lager drinker so no exoert

title: Best theme park ever (for a 12 yr old)
text: Just returned and visited several times over our 2 week stay. Disappointed the The Hulk ride, which is one of Orlando's best, is off line until 2016. The food was plentiful but not cheap. The rides are great fun, particular the Harry Potter area and the water rides (you will get wet and in the case of Bilge Barge Rats, thoroughly drenched). Queues were surprisingly short given it was UK half term. The photo tag system was a very good idea. The whole place is very well organised: Merlin take note!

title: Not as good as it could be
text: OK for a couple of hours but not cheap and not as good as the London venue. Try a get as part of a package
place: Ripley's Believe It or Not! Orlando

title: Good Standard well located Orlando Accommodation
text: Just returned from 2 weeks at the Sheraton. The property is huge with 20+ blocks scattered over a very large site. We stayed in a one-bed in Key West area. There was nothing wrong with the apartment but it was too small really for 3 people as there was barely enough room for the sofa bed when opened. Also, no balcony which was no biggy but a surprise. It was generally well equipped and the washer dryer meant all our clothes came back clean. It is a couple of minutes drive from the main outlet mall at the south end of I-drive. The i-Ride shuttle stops outside and you could use them to get to Universal, Sea World and Wet and Wild without hiring a car, the hotel has a shuttle to Disney and if you miss the return its about $25-30 for a taxi back. We would certainly return but would get a 2 bed apartment for 3 people.
place: Sheraton Vistana Villages Resort Villas, I-Drive/Orlando

title: Excellent Attraction which ups the whole park significantly
text: The 2 separate HP areas are worth a vsit on their own. 3 very good main rides and a couple of others and fantastically well done "train journey" from Kings Cross (platform 93/4 ) to Hogsmeade
place: The Wizarding World of Harry Potter

title: Brilliant, definitely The Right Stuff
text: I have been here 3 times before and am always overwhelmed by the bravery and intrepidness of the astronaut corp and the ingenuity of NASA. The Saturn display on the main site at the end of the bus tour is excellent and the scale of everything is incredible. Back at the Visitor Centre the new Atlantis Shuttle is truly awesome and, it includes the only ride in Florida that does not end in the gift shop (though there is an excellent shop on site). My 12 yr old daughter thoroughly enjoyed the day. We did not have enough time to do everything this is a very full day out and about 1 hour from I-Drive
place: NASA Kennedy Space Center Visitor Complex

title: OK but expensive when Manchester is busy
text: Clean, functional, surprisingly quiet but lacking in any sort of soul. Reception and staff general very helpful. Food adequate but there are some better places nearby. Breakfast buffet had everything you would expect but was only lukewarm.

title: OK, but nothing special
text: Food was an OK buffet with a reasonable choice but not kept hot enough and I don't think the staff kept a close enough on the kids who served themselves and dropped utensils on the floor and then put them back. Staff were well motivated and helpful.

title: Tired Looking but great for kids
text: we have stayed here 3 times now over the last 10 years and nothing has changed which explains why it looks in need of some TLC. The rooms are OK, if a little cramped but the lack of ventilation makes everything feel and smell a little damp. It can be noisy in rooms near the bar. That said, your kids will love it and it is very convenient for the Waterpark and for early park access which means you can ride Nemesis and Air a couple of times without queuing. the staff are very good.

title: Really Excellent Asian Food
text: this is an excellent restaurant serving top quality Asian food in a lively an interestingly decorated setting

title: Noisy
text: Not impressed, a poky room next to the lift on what appeared to be a boxed in landing with no proper window. Permanent el;ectrical "hum" and shouting through the night for the street outside. Bathroom good though.

title: Good Quays location
text: This is a standard Premier Inn, well lcoated for the Quays and Media City with plenty of parking. Restaurant for breakfast is the adjacent Beefeater which serves a reasonable evening meal too. Rooms fine and very comfy Premier Inn beds.
place: Premier Inn Manchester Salford Quays hotel

title: Tired and Noisy
text: I was disappointed at this Premier Inn. Normally they have a fairly consistent standard but this was very dated and a bit threadbare. Also, the rooms on the back of the hotel overlook some rail tracks which were in use for freight traffic all night. Breakfast next door was fine but on the hole this was a disappointing experience.

title: Great Return Visit
text: We returned to Azul Fives for the October half-term. There has been a few changes with some landscaping work and a couple of new blocks near the front. Any building work was unintrusive. Food, accommodation, cleanliness and service were all excellent but a few things were closed or being refurbished during our 1st few days though technically this was Mexican low season so probably to be expected. Overall we enjoyed another excellent break and would recommend this place to anyone. Niggles: paying for wifi? Cancun airport baggage collection is a joke though this is nothing to do with the hotel.

title: Great Day Out - get there early
text: There is a huge variety of things to see and do here and arriving at 10:30 on an organised trip when the park opened at 8:30 meant we ran out of time. If there are more than 2 of you travelling from outside Cancun if maybe worth getting a taxi as you would get longer at the park. The evening show is spectacular, the snorkelling was terrific with as much variety of fish life as I saw at the Gt Barrier Reef, including large sting rays swimming 1 metre away. If there are more than 2 of you travelling from outside Cancun if maybe worth getting a taxi as you would get longer at the park.

title: Decent Food but Noisy
text: The Black Swan is a good village pub, close to Manchester with easy road access. The rooms are new and well appointed. I didn't have a problem with the TV and everything seemed to work OK. However, rooms over the bar/restaurant can be noisy and especially so if there is any entertainment. Those facing the road also have some noise issues and the creaking floorboards as people walk around upstairs were irritating. The bar menu is good and the food first rate. There did not appear to be a lift.

title: excellent little slice of Italian cooking
text: We found on Tripadvisor due to the good reviews and were really impressed. Its a cosy little restaurant on a suburban road but with great staff and cooking it belies its ordinary surroundings. Well worth a visit, try the Fragato a million miles from school dinner liver.

title: great grounds and external recreation area
text: The grounds, woods and external areas were lovely, the house was ok but access is to only a small part. Opening hours are short so dont get there too late in the day.

title: OK, but not great
text: Visited during the half-term week, and whilst it was OK and improved further into the attraction . However, there was too much queuing and the whole thing seemed overcrowded, rushed and a prime example of Merlin squeezing every ounce from their customers in pursuit of profit. If you get it free as part of a package then its probably worthwhile but I would rate all the other Merlin attractions higher for a day out, and the free museums are much better. Its not particularly frightening either which was disappointing given its name and advertising

title: Best Ever All-Inclusive
text:
This was our 10th all-inc holiday and the 6th in the Carribean and without doubt it was a class above anything we have enjoyed before. Firstly to answer some negative comments that I have seen:

The hotel can do nothing about - the flight time and quality from the UK; transfer time from Cancun (its 40min direct); the road from the highway (v pot-holed); weather (3 days of tropical downpour); departure tax (£45 each); prices in local shops (same as UK); rough sea (great fun).

So to the things that the hotel does very well:
The staff, whatever their roles, are excellent, and a special shout out to Carlos whose first day coincided with our arrival. He is a brilliant character and waiter and we expect to see him as Restaurant and then Food and Beverage manager in future visits.

The property is spotlessly clean and has immaculate well-groomed grounds. The beach has been built up and protected so that it is in excellent condition and safe for children (look next door to see how rocky it used to be). All the food outlets serve excellent food with plenty of choice. Sea Olive served me the best New York strip steak I have ever had - 3 days in a row. Availabity at the booked restaurants was generally OK. The kids club is terrific with excellent staff and equipment and a good programme of activities. The 3 pools are great, clean and with warm water, and no room is more than a few steps from its entrance to one of them. All have swim up bars and there were always plenty of loungers available somewhere. The Spa was first class and there are all sorts of deals available.

The daily entertainment programme at the infinity pool was reasonably low-key and not pressured, though why they feel the need to play club music all the time is beyond me; fine when it supports an activity but then switch it off please. If people want to listen music its unlikely to be what the animation team want and most have iPods or similar. Evening entertainment was luittle too late for those with young children but the circus and acrodance shows which I saw were very good.

The hotel hosts numerous weddings, mostly at weekends so there is an infux of travellers mostly from the US and Canada. Remember guys, Spring Break is a High School/College thing and if you are getting married at an expensive resort you are probably old enough to behave with a bit more decorum, there are children about! If someone's wedding booking has gone wrong that is desparate for them and the hotel does not have a suitably romantic fallback for seriusly weather-affected weddings.

The resort is about a 7 min walk from breakfast restauarnt to beach and you can always hitch a wide on a buggy. We were in Villa 12 and it was fine. Villas 5-9 were a littel closer to the beach but hey you're on holiday the walk will do you good.

Would we go back? most certainly and we would be happy to recommend it to friends who could come back and haunt us if it went wrong.

A Tip - the resort touts a holiday bond scheme (Prestige Traveller) and you will be induced to attend. If remotely interested, go as early in your holiday as possible that way if you do buy a package you can probably try for a free upgrade for your stay. Even if you do not buy you do get some worthwhile rewards for giving up a couple fo hours of your time (ask for Sara, she was excellent)

title: Great Day Out
text: This is a very slick operation, if a tad pricy but it was well worth it. If you are in or near Playa del Carmen book online and get a taxi, not only will it save you some money but you can get there for first opening and arrange a pick up after it closes so you get to stay as long as possible and do the shopping and photo bit after its shut.

title: Great, fun location but very hot
text:
Our party of 9 had 3 rooms on thje reception level. The rooms and quite bright and cheery with a double bed and bunk beds in the family rooms. Its quite expensive, particularly as it no longer includes free access to the actual splash park, but you do get early access to the Theme Park which allows you to queue jump at lease one of the top rides.
The staff and overall standards were good, parking is only a couple of mins from the monorail to the Park. A couple of points to note: it is not air conditioned so in the current heatwave was uncomfortably hot at night; there is evening entertainment which can be very noisly if you are in a room close to the bar area.

title: Long queues even on a quiet day
text: They need to manage the loading process much better to utilise capacity better. Its frustarting to be stuck in a 30 min queue and watch empty or half-empty cars/carriages/bathtubs etc go by.

title: Great Fun
text: Worth the ticket price. Warm, well patrolled and safe environment with enough to do for a fun 3 hours.

title: Good value holiday hotel
text:
Just returned from a very enjoyable week here. I would be pushed to accept its 5 star status though the staff were terrific across the hotel. The rooms are a little dated, quite sparsely furnished but very clean with nice bathrooms. The beds are OK but the pillows are of a poor quality. The main buffet was good but we found it difficult to get a booking at the al a carte restaurants as it is on a first come basis and you have to get there very early (on the way back from putting towels on the sun loungers!) if you want a child friendly eating time. The animiation team were all very enthusiastic and friendly but their love for loud music blaring over the area of the kids pools was annoying and the comment that were should sit elsewhere was unhelpful when we had to be near the shallow part of the pool as we had a yound child. It was a welcome relief when they were off on Thursday and the resport was quiet. the pools are not heated. The kids club seemed OK but did not have much to offer kids over the age of about 8 or 9. The beach is a mix of sand a stones so flip flops/crocs are essential. It is a 90-120 min flog from the airport and it you have a late flight in a Euro 60 taxi maybe a worthwhile investment. The resort is a mix of nations but the Russians and Germans are in the majority.

Overall a very enjoyable week and if you get a good price then great. If comparing 5 star resorts and the Ritz Carlton is the same price, pick the Ritz as I think this would be a 4-star tourist at best.

title: Floridays - excellent place, great location
text:
Just back from 2 weeks at Floridays. I booked direct with an owner which was little cheaper than with Floridays but there was no other difference. The units are large with 2 (or 3) double bedrooms and a comfortable large living area with kitchen, dining and lounge areas and furniture, Floridays is at the Disnet end of I-Drive (stop 40 on the I-Ride). It has a good swimming pool with a red hot hot-tub and is about a 5 minute walk from a small shopping area with a large Pubix supermarket. The hotel runs bookable shuttles to both Disney and Universal and Wet and Wild and if you miss the return a taxi is a very manageble $25-3, with the I-Ride stopping at the entrance you can easily manage an Orlando holiday without the expense of a car. A booked car from the airport is about $60.

Overall we had an excellent 2 weeks and would recommend Floridays as an ideal location for an Orlando Theme-Park centred holidays.

title: Worth staying late for
text: Great show, The later show is much less busy and worth staying later for asyou will get a much better seat without queuing for 60 minutes
